items.sentence: I don\'t know where Tom bought his computer.
I don\'t know whether to believe him or not.
Tom told me that he\'d like to visit Boston.
Tom threw Mary\'s sunglasses out the window.
Tom is planning on taking pictures tomorrow.
I don\'t allow my children to eat junk food.
I told the story to anyone who would listen.
You look like you\'re doing just great, Tom.
Tom didn\'t know what Mary was trying to do.
Tom didn\'t notice Mary had a new hairstyle.
Tom didn\'t pay attention to what Mary said.
Tom didn\'t peel the apple before he ate it.
Do you recognize the person in this picture?
Do you speak any language other than French?
I\'ve never told you what actually happened.
How fast can you legally drive on this road?
What kind of flowers should we get for Mary?
Don\'t you think we\'re going to be rescued?
Tom is your neighbor\'s grandson, isn\'t he?
I can\'t believe that you\'re a grandmother.
Tom is the one who usually does the driving.
Tom is the one who wanted to get here early.
Tom is the only one who ever really knew me.
Thank you for agreeing to see me after work.
The deadline for the reports is next Monday.
Tom has a lot of money, but he isn\'t happy.
Tom will be returning to Australia tomorrow.
I wouldn\'t let Tom do what he wanted to do.
Tom stayed in Boston for about three months.
Tom still goes to Boston a few times a year.
Tom still lives in the house he was born in.
Tom suddenly realized that he was in danger.
Do you feel resentment towards your parents?
Tom wanted Mary to drive, so he could sleep.
I don\'t know where Tom bought his umbrella.
I\'ve advised Tom to start doing that again.
Tom sure ate a lot. He must\'ve been hungry.
I think I speak French about as well as Tom.
I\'ll be glad to drink a glass of champagne.
I\'ll be grateful if you can do that for me.
I\'ll be presenting a paper at a conference.
I\'ll do my very best not to disappoint you.
I have an older brother and an older sister.
I wonder whether Tom was embarrassed or not.
Tom and I exchange presents every Christmas.
Tom and I happened to get on the same train.
Did you think that was what I wanted to buy?
Did you want to go to the library yesterday?
The two brothers are like two peas in a pod.
Aren\'t you still planning to quit your job?
